trans-unit.source: Represents a collection of <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow"></xref> objects in a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView"></xref> control.
The GridViewRowCollection class is used to store and manage a collection of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> objects in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.
Each row in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control is represented by a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> object.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control stores all of its data rows in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.Rows%2A> collection.

The GridViewRowCollection class supports several ways to access the items in the collection: - Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRowCollection.Item%2A> indexer to directly retrieve a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> object at a specific zero-based index.
- Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRowCollection.GetEnumerator%2A> method to retrieve an enumerator that can be used to iterate through the collection.

- Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRowCollection.CopyTo%2A> method to copy the items in the collection into an <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName> object, which can then be used to access the items in the collection.
To determine the total number of items in the collection, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRowCollection.Count%2A> property
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRowCollection"></xref> class using the specified <xref href="System.Collections.ArrayList"></xref> object.

Use this constructor to initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRowCollection> class using the specified <xref:System.Collections.ArrayList?displayProperty=fullName> object.
The <xref:System.Collections.ArrayList?displayProperty=fullName> object should contain the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> objects with which to populate the collection.
An <xref href="System.Collections.ArrayList"></xref> object that contains the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow"></xref> objects with which to initialize the collection.

Copies all the items from this <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRowCollection"></xref> to the specified <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName> object, starting at the specified index in the <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName> object.

Use this method to copy the items in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRowCollection> object into the specified <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName> object, starting at the specified index.
The <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName> object can then be used to access the items in the collection.
> [!NOTE] > You must use a zero-based <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName> object for the `array` parameter.
A zero-based <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName> object that receives the copied items from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRowCollection"></xref> object.
The first index in the specified <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName> object to receive the copied contents.
Gets the number of items in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRowCollection"></xref> object.
Use the Count property to determine the number of items in the collection.
The Count property is commonly used when iterating through the collection to determine the upper bound of the collection.
The Count property is also commonly used to determine whether a collection is empty.
The number of items in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRowCollection"></xref> object.
Returns an enumerator that contains all <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow"></xref> objects in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRowCollection"></xref>.
Use this method to get an enumerator that can be iterated through linearly to access each item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRowCollection>.
To access the item at the current position in the enumerator, use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Current%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
Use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.MoveNext%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to move to the next item in the collection.
To move the enumerator to its initial position, use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Reset%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.

> [!NOTE] > When you initially get the enumerator or use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Reset%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to move the enumerator to the first item in the collection, you must call the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.MoveNext%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
Otherwise, the item that is represented by the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Current%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is undefined.

An <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator?displayProperty=fullName> implemented object that contains all <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow"></xref> objects in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRowCollection"></xref>.
Gets a value indicating whether the rows in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRowCollection"></xref> object can be modified.
Use the IsReadOnly property to determine whether the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> objects in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRowCollection> object can be modified.

> [!NOTE] > This property has been overridden to always return `false` to indicate that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> objects in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRowCollection> object can be modified in all cases.
Always returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRowCollection"></xref> object is synchronized (thread-safe).
Use the IsSynchronized property to determine whether the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRowCollection> object is thread-safe.
> [!NOTE] > This property has been overridden to always return `false` to indicate that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRowCollection> object is not thread-safe.

For more information on the IsSynchronized property, see the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection.IsSynchronized%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property of the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection?displayProperty=fullName> interface.
Always returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow"></xref> object at the specified index.
Use this indexer to retrieve a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> object from the collection at the specified index, using array notation.
The index of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow"></xref> object to retrieve from the collection.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow"></xref> object at the specified index in the collection.
Gets the object used to synchronize access to the collection.
Use the SyncRoot property to get an object that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.
The object returned in this implementation is the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRowCollection> object itself.

For more information on the SyncRoot property, see the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection.SyncRoot%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property of the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection?displayProperty=fullName> interface.
An <xref:System.Object?displayProperty=fullName> that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.
For a description of this member, see <xref:System.Collections.ICollection.CopyTo*>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRowCollection> instance is cast to the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection?displayProperty=fullName> interface.

The one-dimensional <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName> object that is the destination of the elements copied from the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection?displayProperty=fullName> interface.
The array must have zero-based indexing.
The zero-based index in a <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName> object at which copying begins.
